{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gingival deformities refer to abnormalities in the gums. ANUG, or Acute Necrotizing Ulcerative Gingivitis, is a gum disease that causes ulcers and inflammation, which can lead to deformities in the gums. Internal resorption is a process where the tooth's dentin is broken down and absorbed, which doesn't directly affect the gums. Cementomas are benign tumors of the cementum, a part of the tooth, and do not cause gingival deformities. Periapical cysts are located at the apex of a tooth root and do not cause deformities in the gums.", "answer_choice": "A"}
